design_system.name: Atmospheric Glass
design_system.description: A visually stunning, glassmorphism-based weather dashboard that adapts its ambient lighting to weather conditions.

glass_surfaces.input: bg-black/20 backdrop-blur-md border border-white/10 text-white placeholder:text-white/50 focus:bg-black/30 focus:border-white/30 transition-all
glass_surfaces.tooltip: bg-black/60 backdrop-blur-md border border-white/10 text-white rounded-lg shadow-xl

SearchBar.style: Floating pill shape, centered or top-left, glass effect.
SearchBar.interaction: Expand on focus, dropdown with blur.

CurrentWeather.style: Hero section, large typography, abstract 3D element on right.

WeatherChart.style: Recharts AreaChart, gradient fill, minimal axes.

CityList.style: Vertical list or chips, quick access.

DailyForecast.style: Vertical stack or grid of small cards.

assets.icons: Use lucide-react with stroke-width={1.5} for a thin, elegant look. Increase size (w-8 h-8 or w-12 h-12) for emphasis.

universal_guidelines: Avoid generic 'SaaS Blue' (#3B82F6) as a primary color. Use the dynamic palettes.
Glass panels MUST have a border (border-white/10 or border-white/20) to define edges.
Text contrast is critical. If background is dark, text must be white. If background is light (Snowy), text must be dark.
Use 'Manrope' for all headings to give a modern, friendly feel.
Animations: Use framer-motion for smooth entrance (opacity: 0 -> 1, y: 20 -> 0).
Charts: Hide grid lines in Recharts if possible, or make them very subtle (stroke='#ffffff20'). Use 'monotone' curve for lines.
All interactive elements must have data-testid attributes.

implementation_steps: 1. Install dependencies: lucide-react, recharts, framer-motion, clsx, tailwind-merge.
2. Configure Tailwind: Add custom colors and fonts in tailwind.config.js.
3. Create 'WeatherLayout' component that accepts 'weatherCode' and sets the global background gradient.
4. Build 'GlassCard' reusable component with the defined glass styles.
5. Implement 'CurrentWeather' hero using the 'sunny_abstract' or 'rainy_abstract' images as subtle overlays or side visuals.
6. Build the Dashboard Grid using the Bento layout rules.
7. Integrate Open-Meteo API and map codes to the palettes.
